name: Kathita Goel
bio: Kathita Goel is Product Technology Manager at Google. Apart from her core job, she is learning to sing, passionate about mentoring college students via Women Techmakers Engineering Fellows program and working with few friends in the space of elderly care(growingold.in). Kathita Goel has an unquenchable zeal to learn and share  new things!

name: Rashi Desai
bio: Rashi is a Data Science Intern at PepsiCo and a graduate student at the University of Illinois, Chicago. While she completes her graduation, she has pivoted her interests in data-driven decision making and making data more approachable. She currently heads INFORMS UIC Chapter- an organization that brings together professionals from fields of Data and Business. She believes in creating an impact with every endeavor by breaking the glass ceiling. On weekends, Rashi can usually be found blogging about data, UX and new in technology with a good cup of hot chocolate in a Chicago cafe!

name: Dharmesh Vaya
bio:
Dharmesh is a technologist known for his ability of developing enterprise applications on Cloud Platforms and fostering a spirit of innovation among teams, with a diverse experience around Banking, e-Commerce, Media/Entertainment to name a few.

Currently he is the Director of Technology at Agrahyah Technologies. He is a Google Developer Expert for Google Cloud Platform and actively manages Google Cloud Developers Community, Mumbai.

name: Sairee Chahal
bio:
Sairee Chahal is Founder and CEO of SHEROES – the world’s largest online ecosystem for women, comprising the SHEROES app, Babygogo, SHECO, SHEROES Money, MARS by SHEROES and Naaree.com. The network has a national and global footprint of 21 million women. 
Sairee is on the Board of Directors of Paytm Payments Bank and Milaan Foundation, and on the advisory board of US-based initiative Women In Cloud.   
 
She has an M. Phil from JNU and a PGDBM from IMT Ghaziabad. She is an Aspen  Fellow and a Cartier Award Alumni. In a personal capacity, Sairee has mentored hundreds of women entrepreneurs, and continues to do so to help strengthen the women-led entrepreneurship ecosystem

name: Bhavani Ravi
bio: Bhavani Ravi is a Research Engineer at  Saama Technologies, a part of the team that built the SDQ application to fast-track Pfizer’s clinical trials for the CoVID vaccine. She has made Open source contributions to famous Python libraries like Rasa and Pandas. She is the founder of TheLearningDev to teach Python-based applications via Bootcamps. She is a community activist and runs  WomenTechMakers and Build2Learn  Chennai community, She is also a blogger, YouTuber, producing Talkoverflow podcast. You can find more about her at bhavaniravi.com

name: Shilpa Garg
bio: Shilpa is a Software Engineer presently working in the field of Machine Learning(NLP). She is a Tech Speaker, Google MLCC Facilitator, python mentor at 1 million Women to Tech by Oxford Entreprenurers & presently working as Lead AI Consultant in Edtech. Company, with a total experience of 5+ years in the Industry. She is organiser of GDG New Delhi & WTM Ambassador as well. She loves community building, Innovation and empowering Women in Tech.

name: Varsha Jaiswal
bio: Aiming towards a goal and making continuous effort to achieve it is what I believe. I am a girl who puts thinking into each step towards giving back to the community by sharing the knowledge with everyone who is in the quest for it. Hardwork and Determination are the two values that I hold close to my heart. Working as a Software Engineer, I have keen interest in working on new technologies. Being the Gold facilitator of the #IamRemarkable initiative by Google, I always give my best to motivate my people around me. Empowering women and having gender equity has always been my motive and this led me to be the Chapter Lead for Malikah where I will be helping women out in many ways. Despite busy schedules, I never miss an opportunity to travel and eat.!

name: Vrijraj Singh
bio:
Vrijraj is a front-end developer by profession and a community champion by passion. He is an organizer for GDG Jalandhar and a Google Developers Expert for Firebase and Web Technologies.

He has given 100+ talks and workshops for communities over the past 5 years. His areas of expertise are around Web, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, and UI/UX Design. He is always eager to learn new technologies and develop solutions based on them. He enjoys mentoring people and  nurturing communities. Outside work, he is a foodie and enjoys watching YouTube videos.

name: Lavanya Arora
bio: Lavanya is a Product Manager at Google and leads Fraud Defense for Google Maps. She is passionate about fighting abuse and ensuring users have a safe and delightful experience. She has been with Google for the past one year and is based out of their Bangalore office. Prior to Google, she has worked in varied domains such as semiconductors and Ad-tech at  companies like Synopsys and Directi. She holds an MBA from the Indian School of Business and a B.Tech from IIIT Hyderabad. As an undergraduate student, she was extensively involved in research and has published many papers. Her work on Blood Glucose sensing using machine learning techniques was awarded the best student paper at the 9th IEEE International Conference on Sensing Technology, New Zealand.Outside of work she is a fitness enthusiast and loves doing Crossfit and Olympic weightlifting. She also enjoys travelling and exploring new places.

name: Bhuvana Kundumani
bio: Bhuvana Kundumani is an engineer by education, entrepreneur by profession and a curious learner by nature. Her career started at Deloitte in finance. A few years later, she founded ThinkDiff S’kool– a STEM center focused on learning by doing and learning by design. Through this venture, she mentored teenage kids for international skills transfer programs like Leangap and Technovation. She had the privilege of being a part of the team which was selected to present their pitch at Google, Mountain View. Inspired, she started her journey with AI in 2018. She is currently working on NLP in the Biomedical domain.

name: Shivasankari Bhuvaneswaran
bio: With Storytelling as my core skill, I have worked across multiple marketing disciplines in both small and large tech startups. I have helped build and execute global thought leadership campaigns for both branding and demand generation. At Zuper, I am the chief storyteller who is incharge of narrating our brand story to the world  :)

name: Hemadhevi Nagarajan
bio: I m Hemadhevi Nagarajan, I m Lifestyle Gamification Specialist. I m the founder of Walk the Talk Champion Hub. I m on a mission to empower children by helping them a live happy, healthy and successful lifestyle and become a champion of their life.

name: Juhi Singh
bio: A girl who believes in community.

name: Shachi Dave
bio: Shachi Dave is a Research Engineer in the Natural Language Understanding group at Google Research India. She received her Masters degree in Computer Science from University of Southern California, Los Angeles. Her research interests include, natural language understanding, conversational AI and data mining/modeling and their applications to various products like Search and Assistant.

name: Sai Gole
bio: Sai is graduate in Product Design from IIT Madras. She has been involved in robotics and was part of IITM robotics team and had represented IITM and India in various national and international competitions. After graduation worked with one of the biggest FMCG company in India. She started BharatAgri in 2017. BharatAgri has developed unique technology for personalized advisory and communication for 140 Mn Indian farming families which users can subscribe for tech-enabled farming.

name: Shwetha Lakshman Rao
bio: Shwetha is Staff Engineer at VMware with 14+ years of industry experience. She is Senior Director of WomenWhoCode(a community of 2lakh+ passionate technologists), has inspired several women to think beyond regular deliverables and contribute towards Innovations (including hackathons, present research papers in different conference, patents) and give back to the women in community through WomenWhoCode. She drives multiple versatile initiatives to create opportunities for Engineers in VMware India and help customers. She is mentor and evaluator for Govt of India’s Smart India Hackathon, one of the biggest Hackathon in the world with 5 lakh + students participating from all over India. She has been awarded with “#ApplaudHer 2019” from WomenWhoCode and IEEE for her contribution in the community. She holds a patent from US patent attorney and won several hackathons.

name: Aananya T
bio: Aananya is a developer experience engineer at Kubric.io apart from being an advocate for women in tech through WTM bangalore. She lives by “lift as you climb” as her principle (heard it first in an IWD event !! ). She’s powered by idlis, empathy and art & loves talking about code, creativity & community

name: Ramya Kappagantu
bio: I am Ramya. I currently work as a Software Engineer at Oracle. I have been leading Women Techmakers Nagpur as an Ambassador for the past 1.5 year empowering women and creating visibility to them. I am also a Developer Student Clubs Lead formerly, where I created awareness about Google technologies to university students through various campaigns and initiatives. I have a great passion towards databases, Machine Learning and specifically how data helps in improving the performance of ML/DL applications. In my spare time, I love to doodle.

name: Lakshya Sivaramakrishnan

company.name: Google
company.designation: Program Manager at Women Techmakers India

bio: Lakshya manages the Women Techmakers Program in India. She is a data science enthusiast building tech expertise in Machine Learning and Google Cloud. She enjoys nurturing communities and empowering more women to join, thrive and lead in the tech industry.

name: Dhrumil Shah
bio: Dhrumil Shah, the GDE of Flutter & Dart, the co-organiser of GDG Ahmedabad, Senior Mobile Application Developer at HighLevel and Founder of @Flutter_Flakes. He has done Masters in Computer Engineering in Wireless and Mobile Computing. Being an expert, he has an excellent command over developing applications, organising events, workshops, and mentoring developers and students that have made him a good trainer as well as an avid speaker in his domain.

name: Vinita Sharma
bio: I am a backend developer, with more than 6 years of experience working across different companies including Myntra and some very early stage startups. I have worked across various stages in the lifecycle of product, building from Zero to One and also scaling up from early customers to a larger market. When I am not building systems or learning about the latest stuff, I will mostly be painting or playing chess.

name: Priya Tiru
bio: Priya is the co-organiser of GDG & WTM Hubli. Few words that describe her pretty well are - Creative, Energetic, Imaginative and Hardworking.She is always motivated by her wish that she wants to do something very different from others. She has always been passionate about technology more of how technology can bring change in the surroundings. Apart from this, she loves management, art and food!

name: Meenakshi Varadarajan
bio: Meenakshi is a seasoned Engineering Leader with more than two decades of industry experience in building and leading highly motivated teams. She has conceived and built products in Data Warehousing, BigData and IIoT space which are quintessence of technology led business innovation. Meenakshi has the strong belief that an inclusive culture at organizations helps to bring about the best in teams and individuals. She is the Director of Engineering at Google Cloud's Business Application Platform.
